title: A Spy Satellite You’ve Never Heard of Helped Win the Cold War
excerpt: Engineers at the Naval Research Lab launched a spy satellite program called Parcae and revolutionized signals intelligence at the height of the Cold War. The program relied on computers to sift through intelligence data, providing a technological edge at a pivotal moment in the Cold War.

title: She was a global superstar. She was a world-class spy.
The ghostly radio station that no one claims to run
excerpt: “MDZhB” has been broadcasting since 1982. No one knows why.

title: How a Saxophonist Tricked the KGB by Encrypting Secrets in Music
excerpt: Using a custom encryption scheme within music notation, Merryl Goldberg and three other US musicians slipped information to Soviet performers and activists known as the Phantom Orchestra.

excerpt: The mission, still a secret to this day, was so dangerous many men bid emotional goodbyes...

title: ‘I’d Never Been Involved in Anything as Secret as This’

title: During the Cold War, the CIA Secretly Plucked a Soviet Submarine From the Ocean Floor Using a Giant Claw
